Most(all?) of the REST theory I've read, and maybe all the examples,

ses altering the state of one resource when hitting a URL. But I

ng into cases where it looks like I need to alter the state

ne resource in one hit. 

Here is a simplified example:
Suppose there are r=
esources where a particular attribute must be
unique across the set of all =
those resources. If A has color red, then
B cannot have color red. Now imag=
ine it needs to be possible to swap
the state of two resources with respect=
 to this attribute. If I start
with 

A.color=3Dred   and  B.color=3Dgreen
=

I need to end up with 

A.color=3Dgreen   and  B.color=3Dred

In order to =
preserve the requirement of uniqueness, I want to do this
in a single hit.
=

A a=
nd B to, and it changes the state of both.

ad the REST theory, but I can't come up

w to make this closer to theory? Or

st have to bend the rules?
